metadata.case: Marc Castillo v. Charles Schwab Corporation, Sedgwick Claims Management Services, et al.

phases.name: Phase 1: Initial Disclosure & Retaliation
phases.description: SOX disclosures trigger immediate retaliation, medical escalation begins

phases.name: Phase 2: Medical Escalation & FMLA Interference
phases.description: Medical condition worsens due to stress, FMLA interference escalates, Sedgwick introduced

phases.name: Phase 3: Benefits Battle & Network Sabotage
phases.description: Systematic benefits denials, IT sabotage creates performance pretexts, financial pressure mounts

phases.name: Phase 4: Sedgwick Fraud & Severance Coercion
phases.description: Metadata fraud discovered, termination executed, severance coercion attempted

phases.name: Phase 5: Post-Termination & Legal Action
phases.description: EEOC charge, federal litigation, discovery, summary judgment preparation

events.title: Initial SOX-Protected Disclosure
events.description: Marc Castillo disclosed to Babchuk and Egorov that Schwab's marketing materials misrepresented investment products in violation of SEC regulations
events.significance: Protected activity triggering all subsequent retaliation under SOX § 806

events.title: First Retaliatory Action: Performance Critique
events.description: Seven days after disclosure, Babchuk initiated unprecedented negative performance reviews
events.significance: Temporal proximity (7 days) establishes prima facie retaliation. Stone v. City of Indianapolis, 281 F.3d 640

events.title: Disclosure of ADA-Protected Disability
events.description: Castillo formally disclosed hypertension diagnosis and requested reasonable accommodation
events.significance: Establishes knowledge of disability, triggering ADA protections. 42 U.S.C. § 12112(b)(5)(A)

metadata.legalStandard: ADA requires interactive process for accommodations

events.title: Medical Escalation: Blood Pressure Crisis
events.description: Hypertensive crisis (BP 180/110) requiring emergency intervention. Dr. Tapia documented work-related stress as contributing factor
events.significance: Direct medical evidence linking retaliation to health deterioration. Establishes serious health condition under FMLA

events.title: First FMLA Request
events.description: Castillo formally requested intermittent FMLA leave for medical appointments with medical certification

events.title: Medical Crisis: ER Visit for Hypertensive Emergency
events.description: Second hypertensive emergency (BP 195/115) with chest pain requiring ER visit. Physician documented acute work-related stress
events.significance: Life-threatening medical event caused by retaliation. Supports constructive discharge: employment hazardous to health

events.title: Network Access Issues Begin
events.description: First network access failure - unable to log into systems for 6 hours. IT claimed system glitch but only affected Castillo
events.significance: First in pattern of IT sabotage designed to create performance pretexts

events.title: Sedgwick Metadata Backdating Discovered
events.description: Forensic analysis revealed systematic metadata manipulation. DCNs not matching file creation dates across 15+ documents
events.significance: Smoking gun evidence of fraud. Backdating = spoliation. May warrant punitive damages and sanctions

metadata.legalImpact: Federal Rule of Evidence 37(e) - spoliation sanctions

events.title: Termination Notice (Constructive Discharge Alternative)
events.description: Schwab issued termination citing performance deficiencies. Offered severance conditioned on release of all claims
events.significance: Culmination of 2-year retaliation scheme. Pretextual termination based on FMLA leave, IT sabotage, and protected complaints

metadata.alternativeTheory: Constructive discharge if termination not deemed formal

events.title: Timeline System Operational
events.description: Comprehensive timeline generation system operational with evidence cross-referencing and correlation analysis
events.significance: Timeline demonstrates systematic retaliation, temporal proximity, causal chains, and statistical improbability of coincidence

correlations.description: Pattern of retaliation → medical crisis → escalating health deterioration
Protected disclosures followed by adverse actions within 7 days (consistent pattern)
Systematic benefits denials → financial pressure → termination coercion
IT sabotage events create performance pretexts leading to termination
Systematic Sedgwick metadata manipulation across 15+ documents over 18 months
